program main

implicit none

integer :: n, i, val, max_count, num_unique, current_count
integer, dimension(100) :: keys, counts
logical :: found
character(len=20) :: s1, s2, s
integer :: m, i_char
character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: reversed_s
integer*8, dimension(0:12) :: dp_prev, dp_current
integer :: MOD = 10**9 +7
integer :: base =1
integer :: current_char, d, pre, new_mod
integer :: result

! First part: read input and compute max_count and num_unique

! Read n
read*, n

! Initialize keys and counts
num_unique =0
keys =0
counts =0 do i =1, n
   read*, val
   found = .false. do j =1, num_unique
      if (keys(j) == val) then
         counts(j) = counts(j)+1
         found = .true.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
exit
      end if
   end do
   if (.not. found) then
      num_unique = num_unique +1
      keys(num_unique) = val
      counts(num_unique) =1
   end if
end do

! Find max_count
max_count =0
do j =1, num_unique
   if (counts(j) > max_count) then
      max_count = counts(j)
   end if
end do

! Form the string s
write(s1, '(i0)') max_count
write(s2, '(i0)') num_unique
s = trim(s1)//trim(s2)

! Second part: process the string s through DP

m = len_trim(s)
allocate(reversed_s(m)) do i_char =1, m
   reversed_s(i_char) = s(m -i_char +1: m -i_char +1)
end do

! Initialize DP
dp_prev =0
dp_prev(0) =1

do i =1, m
   character(len=1) :: c = reversed_s(i)
   dp_current =0
   if (c == '?') then
      do d =0,9
         do pre =0,12
            new_mod = mod( pre + base *d, 13 )
            dp_current(new_mod) = mod( dp_current(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD )
         end do
      end do
   else
      read(c,*) current_char
      d = current_char
      do pre =0,12
         new_mod = mod( pre + base *d, 13 )
         dp_current(new_mod) = mod( dp_current(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD )
      end do
   end if
   dp_prev = dp_current
   base = mod( base *10, 13 )
end do

result = dp_prev(5)
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
print*, result

deallocate(reversed_s)

end program main

end program main

The full code would be:

program main

implicit none

integer :: n, i, val, max_count, num_unique, current_count
integer, dimension(100) :: keys, counts
logical :: found
character(len=20) :: s1, s2, s
integer :: m, i_char
character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: reversed_s
integer*8, dimension(0:12) :: dp_prev, dp_current
integer :: MOD = 10**9 +7
integer :: base =1
integer :: current_char, d, pre, new_mod
integer :: result

! First part: read input and compute max_count and num_unique

! Read n
read*, n

! Initialize keys and counts
num_unique =0
keys =0
counts =0

do i =1, n
   read*, val
   found = .false.
   do j =1, num_unique
      if (keys(j) == val) then
         counts(j) = counts(j)+1
         found = .true.
         exit
      end if
   end do
   if (.not. found) then
      num_unique = num_unique +1
      keys(num_unique) = val
      counts(num_unique) =1
   end if
end do

! Find max_count
max_count =0
do j =1, num_unique
   if (counts(j) > max_count) then
      max_count = counts(j)
   end if
end do

! Form the string s
write(s1, '(i0)') max_count
write(s2, '(i0)') num_unique
s = trim(s1)//trim(s2)

! Second part: process the string s through DP

m = len_trim(s)
allocate(reversed_s(m))
do i_char =1, m
   reversed_s(i_char) = s(m -i_char +1: m -i_char +1)
end do

! Initialize DP
dp_prev =0
dp_prev(0) =1

do i =1, m
   character(len=1) :: c = reversed_s(i)
   dp_current =0
   if (c == '?') then
      do d =0,9
         do pre =0,12
            new_mod = mod( pre + base *d, 13 )
            dp_current(new_mod) = mod( dp_current(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD )
         end do
      end do
   else
      read(c,*) current_char
      d = current_char
      do pre =0,12
         new_mod = mod( pre + base *d, 13 )
         dp_current(new_mod) = mod( dp_current(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD )
      end do
   end if
   dp_prev = dp_current
   base = mod( base *10, 13 )
end do

result = dp_prev(5)
print*, result

deallocate(reversed_s)

end program main
